title: [Dynamic Regions] tikv leader can not balance after one tikv network partition for 50m and recover
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
./tikv-server -V

### Steps to reproduce
https://tcms.pingcap.net/dashboard/executions/plan/1710011
ha-tikv-random-to-all-network-partition-last-for-50m

### What did you expect?
tikv leader can balance

### What did happened?

comments_data.body:
the root cause is that tikv can't exec the `transfer leader ` command: 
```
pd log :
"balance-leader {transfer leader: store 6 to 4} (kind:leader, region:504(181, 11), createAt:2023-05-12 10:31:10.308633726 +0800 CST m=+55638.683848862, startAt:2023-05-12 10:31:10.309020766 +0800 CST m=+55638.684235920, currentStep:0, size:12390, steps:[transfer leader from store 6 to store 4]ï¼Œtimeout:[2h3m54s])"
tikv log :
[2023/05/12 11:52:28.695 +08:00] [INFO] [region.rs:258] ["try to transfer leader"] [to_peers="[]"] [to_peer="id: 837 store_id: 4"] [from_peer="id: 507 store_id: 6"] [region_id=504]
[2023/05/12 11:52:28.696 +08:00] [INFO] [transfer_leader.rs:170] ["reject to transfer leader"] [last_index=67798] [index=49315] [reason="pending conf change"] [to="id: 837 store_id: 4"] [peer_id=507] [region_id=504]
```

the log gap between the follower and leader is too big,  so it can't exec the cmd.

after restart the failed store,  the follower can fetch some log (from 49315  to 50014), and the commit index is the latest:
```
[2023/05/12 18:51:22.009 +08:00] [INFO] [peer.rs:489] ["recovery completed"] [apply_index=50014] [peer_id=837] [region_id=504]
[2023/05/12 19:04:04.192 +08:00] [INFO] [transfer_leader.rs:170] ["reject to transfer leader"] [last_index=69421] [index=50014] [reason="pending conf change"] [to="id: 837 store_id: 4"] [peer_id=507] [region_id=504]
[2023/05/12 19:06:41.981 +08:00] [DEBUG] [raft.rs:612] ["Sending from 837 to 507"] [msg="msg_type: MsgHeartbeatResponse to: 507 commit: 69427"] [to=507] [from=837] [raft_id=837] [peer_id=837] [region_id=504]
```
